headline: TerraVolta Announces Sale of Lithium Assets in East Texas and Arkansas
summary: TerraVolta Resources, LLC ("TerraVolta" or the "Company") and its investor, The Energy & Minerals Group ("EMG"), announced that they have closed on a transaction to sell all equity interests in two subsidiaries that own certain leasehold acreage positions in east Texas and southwest Arkansas to Chevron U.S.A. Inc., a subsidiary of Chevron Corporation ("Chevron") (NYSE: CVX).

raw.headline: TerraVolta Announces Sale of Lithium Assets in East Texas and Arkansas

Inc., a subsidiary of Chevron Corporation ("Chevron") (NYSE: CVX).

headline: Chevron Enters Domestic Lithium Sector to Support U.S. Energy Security
summary: HOUSTON, June 17, 2025--Chevron U.S.A. Inc., a subsidiary of Chevron Corporation (NYSE: CVX), announced today the acquisition of two leasehold acreage positions. The first from TerraVolta Resources, whose investor is an affiliate of The Energy & Minerals Group (EMG), and the second from East Texas Natural Resources (ETNR) LLC.

headline: 1 Magnificent High-Yield Energy Stock Down 20% to Buy and Hold Forever
summary: The ups and downs of energy stocks are largely driven by oil and natural gas prices.  Energy is out of favor at the moment, leaving a large number of energy companies lower.  Chevron has a high yield, and its stock has lagged behind its closest peer.

headline: Latest News In Energy Transition - Renewable Surge Revolutionizing Global Energy Investments and Capacity
summary: Renewable energy is experiencing significant growth driven by technological advancements, supportive policies, and a global push for sustainability. Solar photovoltaic (PV) and wind energy, both onshore and offshore, are leading this transition, with forecasts indicating a substantial increase in investment, expected to reach $657.16 billion by 2030. The global installed capacity of renewable energy is projected to surge to 11.2 terawatts by 2035, underscoring the expanding role of renewables...
